conclusion: Consider the first law of thermodynamics and properties of the cycle; change in internal energy is zero in a cyclic process.
Net heat added to the system in one complete cycle is equal to the net work done by the system.
Process A→B is an isobaric expansion.
Process B→C is an isochoric cooling.
Process C→D is an isobaric compression.
Process D→A is an isochoric heating.
Calculate work done in process A→B: W_AB = 1 × 10^5 J.
No work is done in process B→C: W_BC = 0.
Calculate work done in process C→D: W_CD = -7.5 × 10^4 J.
No work is done in process D→A: W_DA = 0.
Calculate net work done in the cycle: W_net = 2.5 × 10^4 J.
Heat added Q is equal to the net work done: Q = 2.5 × 10^4 J.
Final answer: The heat exchange Q is 2.5 × 10^4 J.
